item.name: BulkAction
item.description: These methods enable you to manage notary bulk actions.

item.name: Returns the details of a single bulk action.

request.name: Returns the details of a single bulk action.

description.content:
Given a bulk action ID, this method returns information about the corresponding actions.

[Required authentication scopes](/platform/auth/reference/scopes/): `notary_read`, `signature`, `organization_read`.
(Required) The organization's GUID.
(Required) The ID of the bulk action.
Added as a part of security scheme: apikey

item.name: Removes the specified action from the list of bulk actions.

request.name: Removes the specified action from the list of bulk actions.

description.content:
Given a bulk action ID, this method removes the corresponding action from the stored list of bulk actions. This does not impact the results of the bulk action itself.

[Required authentication scopes](/platform/auth/reference/scopes/): `notary_write`, `signature`, `organization_read`.
(Required) The organization's GUID.
(Required) The GUID of the bulk action.
Added as a part of security scheme: apikey

item.name: Returns the results of a bulk action as a CSV.

request.name: Returns the results of a bulk action as a CSV.

description.content:
Given a bulk action ID, this method returns the results of the bulk action as a CSV.

For bulk pool invites, the CSV includes the name, email, and processing result for each notary that was included in the bulk action request.

[Required authentication scopes](/platform/auth/reference/scopes/): `notary_read`, `signature`, `organization_read`.
(Required) The organization's GUID.
(Required) The GUID of the bulk action.
Added as a part of security scheme: apikey
Added as a part of security scheme: apikey

item.name: Jurisdiction
item.description: This resource provides methods to get information about the jurisdictions of the notaries in your pool.

request.name: Gets information about a specific jurisdiction.

description.content:
Gets information about a specific jurisdiction.

item.name: Gets a list of supported jurisdictions.

request.name: Gets a list of supported jurisdictions.

description.content:
Gets a list of supported jurisdictions.

By default, this method returns only enabled jurisdictions.
To include disabled jurisdictions in the results, set the `includeDisabled` query parameter to **true.**

[Required authentication scopes](/platform/auth/reference/scopes/): `notary_read`.
When **true,** disabled jurisdictions are included in the response.
(Required) The account ID GUID.
When **true,** disabled jurisdictions are included in the response.
Added as a part of security scheme: apikey
When **true,** disabled jurisdictions are included in the response.
Added as a part of security scheme: apikey

description.content: When **true,** disabled jurisdictions are included in the response.

item.name: Notary
Returns the notary specified by the user ID.

request.name: Returns the notary specified by the user ID.

description.content:
Returns the notary specified by the user ID.

In order for a notary to be accessible:

- The user specified by `userId` must be an active notary.
- The caller and the notary must belong to the same organization.

[Required authentication scopes](/platform/auth/reference/scopes/): `notary_read`.
(Required) The account ID GUID.
(Required) The ID of the notary to retrieve.
Added as a part of security scheme: apikey
Added as a part of security scheme: apikey

description.content: Added as a part of security scheme: apikey

response.name: The connecting user is not permitted to access this endpoint.

item.name: Returns a list of available notaries.

request.name: Returns a list of available notaries.

description.content:
This method returns a paginated list of the available notaries for a given account.

[Required authentication scopes](/platform/auth/reference/scopes/): `notary_read`.
The position within the total result set from which to start returning values. Default: 0.
The maximum number of results to return. Default: 100.

Filters the results based on the text that you specify. Use the `searchContext` parameter to limit your search to specific fields.

**Note:** When `searchContext` is set to `Jurisdiction`, you can search by two-letter state abbreviation or full state name. When `searchContext` is set to `SessionType`, you can search by abbreviation (like "ipen" or "ron") or full term (like "in-person" or "remote").

Specifies which fields to search. Valid values:

* `Any` (default)
* `Name`
* `Email` 
* `Jurisdiction`
* `SessionType`

Specifies which fields to search. Valid values:

* `Any` (default)
* `Name`
* `Email` 
* `Jurisdiction`
* `SessionType`

Sorts results according to a specific property. Valid values:

- `NameAsc`
- `NameDesc`
- `EmailAsc`
- `EmailDesc`
- `JurisdictionAsc`
- `JurisdictionDesc`
- `SessionTypeAsc`
- `SessionTypeDesc`

Filters the results based on notary type. Valid values:

- `any`: Include all notaries.
- `ipen`: Only include notaries who are authorized for in-person electronic notarization.
- `ron`: Only include notaries authorized to use remote electronic notarization.
(Required) The account ID GUID.

item.name: Pool
item.description: Each organization account that uses Notary API has a list of notaries that can be included to witness signing, called a notary pool. Your organization's notary pool contains a set of users who can serve as a notary in a remote notary session initiated by your organization.

item.name: Gets the set of pools associated with the current account.

request.name: Gets the set of pools associated with the current account.

description.content:
Gets the set of pools associated with the current account.

[Required authentication scopes](/platform/auth/reference/scopes/): `notary_read`, `organization_read`.
The position within the total result set from which to start returning values. Default: 0.
The maximum number of results to return. Default: 100.
Free text search criteria to filter the pools returned by pool name.
(Required) The organization's GUID.

**Note:** Currently an organization can create only one pool, and that pool cannot be deleted. Subsequent calls  to this method will be blocked.

Creates an invite for a remote notary to join a pool.

This call will return an error if the specified notary already belongs to a pool, or if an invite has already been sent to the notary's email address.

(Required) The ID of the pool.

item.name: Invites multiple remote notaries to join a pool.

request.name: Invites multiple remote notaries to join a pool.

description.content:
This method invites multiple remote notaries to join a pool.

Specify the names and emails of the notaries you want to invite in the `fileToUpload` parameter. The format is as follows:
```
Name,NotaryEmail
Francis Notary,francis@example.com
Luna Notary,luna@example.com
```

[Required authentication scopes](/platform/auth/reference/scopes/): `notary_write`, `signature`, `organization_read`.
(Required) The organization's GUID.
(Required) The ID of the pool.
(Required) Bulk invite instructions CSV file

item.name: PoolUser
item.description: The PoolUser resource describes a remote notary as a member of a particular pool.

item.name: Gets a pool user by pool ID and user ID.

request.name: Gets a pool user by pool ID and user ID.

description.content:
Retrieves a notary pool user specified by a `poolId` and `userId`.

[Required authentication scopes](/platform/auth/reference/scopes/): `notary_read`, `signature`, `organization_read`.
(Required) The organization's GUID.
(Required) The ID of the pool.
(Required) The ID of the user.
Added as a part of security scheme: apikey
Added as a part of security scheme: apikey

item.name: Deletes a remote notary from a pool.

request.name: Deletes a remote notary from a pool.

description.content:
Deletes a remote notary specified by `userId` from the pool specified by `poolId`.

If the remote notary cannot be deleted, the result code is 400 and the `description` in the result body gives more information.

This method expects an HTTP header that contains the notary's email address:

```
Notary-Email: notary@example.com
```

[Required authentication scopes](/platform/auth/reference/scopes/): `notary_write`, `organization_read`.
(Required) The organization's GUID.
(Required) The ID of the pool.
(Required) The ID of the user.
Added as a part of security scheme: apikey
Added as a part of security scheme: apikey

item.name: Gets the notary seal image.

request.name: Gets the notary seal image.

description.content:
Gets the notary seal image for the notary specified by `userId` in the jurisdiction specified by `jurisdictionId`.

<!--
Some jurisdictions will have different standards for if the seal is being used for an IPen or Ron transaction and therefore the API generates multiple seals to support this in some instances for a single UserJurisdiction (these seals would contain the same Name, CommissionId, etc but have some different legal language throughout).
-->

The response is a base-64 encoded string of the seal image in the PNG format.

The `sealType` query parameter is case-sensitive. The only supported value is `Ron`.

**Note:** This method can only be used by remote notaries to get their own notary seal images.

[Required authentication scopes](/platform/auth/reference/scopes/): `notary_read`.
(Required) The account ID GUID.
(Required) The ID of the user.
(Required) The ID of the jurisdiction.
(Required) The seal type. The value must be `Ron`.
Added as a part of security scheme: apikey
Added as a part of security scheme: apikey

item.name: UserJournalSession

item.name: Gets a list of journal sessions for a given user.

request.name: Gets a list of journal sessions for a given user.

description.content:
This method returns a list of journal sessions by ID for the given user.

Note: This method can only be used by remote notaries to get information about themselves.

[Required authentication scopes](/platform/auth/reference/scopes/): `notary_read`.
The position within the total result set from which to start returning values. Default: 0.
The maximum number of results to return. Default: 100.
Filters returned session records by `notaryRecipientId`. Enter multiple values as a comma-separated list.
Filters returned session records by `notaryRecipientId`. Enter multiple values as a comma-separated list.

Filters returned session records by status. Valid values are:

* `Any` (default)
* `Incomplete`
* `Complete`

The session attribute to use to sort the results.

Valid values are:

* `NotarizationDateAsc`
* `NotarizationDateDesc`
* `LastUpdatedDateAsc`
* `LastUpdatedDateDesc` (default)
(Required) The account ID GUID.
(Required) The ID of the user.
The position within the total result set from which to start returning values. Default: 0.
The maximum number of results to return. Default: 100.
Filters returned session records by `notaryRecipientId`. Enter multiple values as a comma-separated list.

Filters returned session records by status. Valid values are:

* `Any` (default)
* `Incomplete`
* `Complete`

The session attribute to use to sort the results.

Valid values are:

* `NotarizationDateAsc`
* `NotarizationDateDesc`
* `LastUpdatedDateAsc`
* `LastUpdatedDateDesc` (default)
